H0.text: What is the name for the process by which heat is transferred by the motion of a fluid. Fluidization

H1.text: What is the name for the process by which heat is transferred by the motion of a fluid. Thermal Diffusion

H2.text: What is the name for the process by which heat is transferred by the motion of a fluid. Advection

H3.text: What is the name for the process by which heat is transferred by the motion of a fluid. Convecting

A4.text: Convection is a process involving bulk movement of a fluid that usually leads to a net transfer of heat through advection.

A5.text: the term convection, [in footnote: [Latin] Convectio, a carrying or conveying] which not only expresses the leading fact, but also accords very well with the two other terms.

A6.text: In meteorology it is the transfer by the wind of an atmospheric mass.

A7.text: Advection is sometimes confused with the more encompassing process of convection, which is the combination of advective transport and diffusive transport.
